Text: Met with public health and elected leaders in Fall River today to hear about the ongoing opioid crisis and discuss my work in Washington. The addiction crisis has only gotten worse during the pandemic. We need to support prevention, treatment, and recovery in all our communities. https://t.co/BnGdohjxJy

Postmaster Louis DeJoy is making a huge mistake rejecting the reality of climate change and the commitments that President Biden has made to confront this crisis. We need to tear this deal up and build an all-electric fleet of USPS vehicles. https://t.co/S3TZcqBXZV

Our global fossil fuel addiction is a catalyst for conflict, but a Green New Deal would be a pathway for peace. The United States must lead our European allies in the clean energy revolution to protect us all—from Russia and from the existential threat of climate.

This is yet another example of the importance of eliminating U.S. and European reliance on Russian dirty energy as quickly as possible. Putin and his cronies continue to fill their pockets with dirty oil and gas money at the expense of Ukraine and European energy independence.

We must continue to provide unwavering support for Ukraine and NATO allies in Europe. President Biden is right to continue seeking a diplomatic resolution, despite the fact that time and again Putin has rejected compromise proposed by the Biden administration, NATO, and Ukraine.
U.S. allies have also stepped up to the plate with tough, targeted sanctions of their own. If Russia’s incursion continues, more sanctions will follow.

President Biden has wisely started implementing sanctions—our best non-military option—to impose consequences on the Kremlin, Russia’s defense sector, and Putin’s petro-oligarch cronies for this blatant violation of international law.

My heart is with the people of Ukraine as they endure a savage, unjustified, and illegal violation of their sovereignty by Putin’s Russia. No country is allowed to draw new borders and use that as a pretext for an invasion.

It should be as easy for a Starbucks worker to organize a union as it is for a Starbucks customer to order their morning coffee. Both are wake-up calls. I stand with @SBWorkersUnited. https://t.co/KBidZVJGpP

Paul Farmer was a health care visionary and revolutionary who understood compassion and care went hand in hand. His passing is a tremendous loss for the global health community. We will all be forever grateful for his work to deliver health care to people around the world.

Good morning from the Malden Warming Center where volunteers are doing God’s work on Earth feeding and caring for people who are homeless. Thank you to the loving and compassionate team at @MaldenWarmth for your work and to the residents who met with me today. https://t.co/Q3VcvDu5sd

We need to account for any fossil fuel pipeline project’s impacts on our communities and the climate. I will be introducing legislation to ensure that all FERC-approved projects are truly in the public interest.

FERC finally asserted its responsibility to consider a gas pipeline’s impacts on the climate, landowners, environmental justice communities, and the environment. This long overdue update to natural gas pipeline policy is an important first step, but much more must be done. https://t.co/oAfA9QxaGW

Public transportation is an essential public good and it should be free for all. @MayorWu and I are talking now about her free bus pilot in Boston, my work in the Senate to make fare-free transit a reality, and what a Green New Deal city looks like. https://t.co/ilfWBCd6lB

Environmental justice needs to be at the forefront of all our policies. That means healthy air, healthy water, healthy food, healthy communities, and a healthy climate. You can’t manage what you don’t measure, so getting this tool right and putting it into practice is critical.

9 days ago, @RepCori and I called on @POTUS to quickly release the Climate and Economic Justice Screening Tool. Today the @WHCEQ released a beta version so that communities can begin to engage and provide insight on how to improve this environmental justice tool. We are grateful. https://t.co/utZuVTtSPl
Join @MayorWu and me today on Twitter Spaces and hear about our fight for free public transportation. We'll be going live at 1PM ET. https://t.co/L2ULECSruV
The clean energy revolution will put us on the road to peace. https://t.co/ClkzUcHGht

In 2020, @RepPressley and I introduced the Freedom to Move Act to fund free, safe, reliable, and accessible public transit. Now communities across Massachusetts are going fare-free. Free transit is no longer only a NUMTOT's dream. It is our reality and we're not slowing down.

We are not out of this pandemic yet. Get vaccinated. Get boosted. And wear a high quality mask. It is especially important for seniors, the immunocompromised, and unvaccinated children to take every step they can to protect themselves against COVID-19. https://t.co/mOiBnq12Vo

Our global addiction to oil and natural gas—from Russia, from Saudi Arabia—keeps our world locked into dangerous cycles of conflict and corruption. But we have a way out. We can build a pathway to a more prosperous, more peaceful clean energy future. https://t.co/dwnwS7Xuva
Our fossil fuel addiction is a catalyst for conflict. There is no military solution to the Ukraine-Russia crisis. A Green New Deal is a pathway for peace. https://t.co/ZvrJF3wUk9

The taskforce will not only help reduce harmful industrial pollutants and emissions, but increase transparency and demand for clean American-made products. https://t.co/b6ekzxo3oC

There’s a negotiated path out of the Ukraine crisis that prevents war. It begins with prompt negotiations on the placement of nuclear capable missiles, military transparency measures, and mutual limits of nuclear weapons not covered by an existing agreement. https://t.co/LTFiPp0A37

I'm speaking in opposition to the nomination of Dr. Robert Califf to lead the FDA. When we met last year, I asked him to commit to ensure the FDA does not make the opioid overdose epidemic worse than it already has. He did not commit to the action we need. https://t.co/4ZV57NteYr

Only by centering justice in our fight against climate change can we save our world and build a more equitable future. Thank you Hannah Vogel and my terrific climate team for working alongside countless advocates and activists in support of this movement.https://t.co/D9TgAyMV59

It is true that the fossil fuel industry is incredibly powerful and well-funded.

But for decades now, the climate movement has persevered, grown stronger, and proven again and again that climate action is a winning issue at the ballot box.

Organized people beat organized money.

This has been a very challenging few years, but 467,000 jobs created in January and 6.6 million in the past 12 months are sure signs of a strong recovery. President Biden deserves a great deal of credit for achieving the best job creation on record in his first year as president.

It’s never been more important to modernize and expand how patients receive opioid treatment. The Opioid Treatment Access Act will help improve access to life-saving methadone treatment for opioid-use disorder.
https://t.co/2I5FYN2f9H

Big oil is raking it in while our planet burns. Last year climate disasters cost the US $145 billion. Meanwhile, the fossil fuel industry saw record profits. ENOUGH. It's time to end our country's addiction to fossil fuels and rapidly transition to clean energy. https://t.co/7el2nr15r8

The final report of the Commission on Combating Synthetic Opioid Trafficking will be our guide as we work to save lives and rebuild communities across the country. This report is not the end of our work, but merely the beginning.

And not just the Department of Justice. The Department of Homeland Security, the Department of Defense, the Department of Interior, and the Department of Health and Human Services should all end their use of Clearview AI’s facial recognition technology.
There is so much to be done at the FCC, and Gigi Sohn is ready to get to work.

Ms. Sohn is a staunch advocate for consumer protection, market competition, and free expression. Her career has been motivated by an unrelenting drive to find pragmatic solutions to pressing problems and to advance telecommunications policies that improve people’s lives.

Gigi Sohn has spent more than 30 years working to protect the public interest. She is one of the most eminently qualified nominees for any office to come before the Senate Commerce Committee and is the embodiment of what the American people deserve in an FCC Commissioner.

Congress should reauthorize the Violence Against Women Act. I support my colleagues who are today introducing a bipartisan bill to renew and strengthen the #VAWA, help protect victims of domestic violence, and support survivors.
 https://t.co/NVdN17ymYs

The Department of Justice should immediately stop the use of facial recognition technology like Clearview's AI tools. Facial recognition technology poses a unique threat to communities of color who are systematically subjected to over-policing.
https://t.co/TFYTfWRib2

The Department of Defense is the largest federal polluter. It should not be exempt from climate-related reporting or planning. I am glad to see that the Army has released a climate change strategy. Now the entire DoD should follow the Army's suit. https://t.co/qjxmqQJFfT

We know that public transit is a public good that should be free for all. Today @MayorWu took a big step forward for the people of Boston, for transit justice, and for climate action. 
https://t.co/aqyPd01F8B

The Ortega-Murillo regime in Nicaragua should release all 150+ political prisoners, not hold them in deplorable conditions and subject them to sham trials. Journalists, political candidates, and civil society activists are the backbone of a free democracy.

I draw inspiration from the climate movement—a movement that has fought the most powerful interests on the planet for decades, all while the world gets hotter, projections more dire, and disasters more common. It is a resilient and righteous movement on the verge of a major win.

The troops of the Ghost Army were composed of America’s most brilliant artists, engineers and signal professionals. They will no longer be unseen in the shadows. I could not be happier to have led the bill that awards the Congressional Gold Medal to the Ghost Army. @CBSMornings https://t.co/fQINMcy2Um

Recent reports about dangerous braking flaws with Tesla’s Autopilot and Full Self Driving systems are the latest in a series of concerning incidents. That’s why @SenBlumenthal and I are demanding answers from the company. We must protect all users of the road. https://t.co/5xZkYaDHF6

I have been in the flight for climate action for a very long time. Been here for the good days and the very, very bad days. And I can say with certainty that we are closer than ever to finally confronting climate change as a nation.
President Biden is right to seek a return to the Iran Nuclear Deal. It is our best path forward to avoid a war with Iran and an Iranian nuclear weapon. https://t.co/DA31LWcfNQ
I am live right now with @RevYearwood talking about the urgency of the climate movement and our moral responsibility to act. Join us! https://t.co/GOS7frNd5k

Climate action now. That is my message with @RevYearwood today on Twitter Spaces. Join us at 1:30pm ET and hear about the strength of our movement, the intersectionality of the climate crisis, and where we are going in 2022. Click the link to RSVP: https://t.co/GOS7fs4NWS. https://t.co/6YNZoepGjN
What I owe to Ray Jordan cannot be measured, and what he has given me, his colleagues, and all of Massachusetts will never be forgotten.

Ray’s friendship, loyalty, and insights have been irreplaceable constants throughout my career. We used to play basketball together on Beacon Hill, and he had an indomitable presence on and off the court.

Ray’s strength of conviction and keen intelligence made him a mentor to countless elected leaders in the Pioneer Valley and beyond, with his living room serving as the launching pad for Western Massachusetts politics.

Ray represented the next generation of Massachusetts politicians whose commitment to progress and reform resonates to this day. He spent his career making housing more affordable, jobs more equitable, and Western Massachusetts more livable.

Ray Jordan was one of the central figures in the transformation of the MA State House and he made sure equal opportunity and justice were central to state policymaking. My condolences go out to his family and all of those who called him friend and neighbor.https://t.co/txgtaUp5Ds

It is unacceptable that the USPS intends to cling to an overwhelmingly fossil-fuel powered fleet. Postmaster DeJoy must correct this flawed plan and electrify the next generation of USPS delivery vehicles. https://t.co/bmYTrnz9hz

Happy birthday my friend @RepPressley. Thankful always for your leadership in Congress in the fight for true justice. https://t.co/YMq4jaAJyt
Together, we commend @NHTSAgov for its ongoing work to investigate the situation and urge the agency to continue taking all appropriate action to protect all users of the road.

The latest developments with Tesla’s Autopilot and Full Self Driving systems are exactly why @SenBlumenthal and I have long expressed concerns with this flawed technology. Automated driving systems must ensure that cars follow the rules of the road and drivers are fully engaged.

I'm going to keep fighting to keep the ECF funded during the pandemic and beyond. We must prevent the "homework gap" from growing into a damaging learning and opportunity gap for children, particularly those in communities of color, low-income households, and rural areas.

DoD is responsible for more than 3/4 of all federal energy use. The Biden admin has taken important steps across agencies to address the climate crisis. But we will simply not meet our emissions reductions goals if we do not address the climate impact of the U.S. military.

President Biden's Executive Order to reduce federal emissions includes a loophole for the Department of Defense big enough drive a tank through. @RepMondaire and I are urging the President to not ignore the largest federal emitter of all: the Pentagon.

Please join me live now for a national town hall on climate action and environmental justice. https://t.co/dBAEHn9foG

We owe him a great debt of gratitude. It is an honor and privilege to call Justice Breyer my dear personal friend, and I wish him the best in his retirement.

Justice Breyer knew that "justice for some" was a failure of the Court, and from his opinions on voting rights, to reproductive rights, to the Affordable Care Act, he has been a key voice in historic decisions that maintain the integrity and legitimacy of our judicial system.

For decades, Justice Breyer has served with grace, expertise, humility, and an unwavering dedication to justice. He has worked tirelessly to build consensus among his fellow justices, and has always kept in mind the real-world impacts of the Court’s decisions on Americans.

Restaurants are cultural, social, and economic backbones of our communities. The American Rescue Plan delivered a life raft to them last year, but as we head into the third year of this pandemic, we need to protect our restaurants and replenish the Restaurant Revitalization Fund.

- Cease deployment of Trump's low-yield W76-2 warhead & further development of a nuclear-armed sea launched cruise missile
- Question the necessity of new nuclear weapons systems & sustainability of the current program of work, including the Ground Based Strategic Deterrent.

This #NuclearPostureReview must
- Declare the sole purpose of nuclear weapons is to deter a nuclear attack on US & allies
- Support negotiations with Russia to limit all types of nuclear weapons
- Prioritize negotiating confidence & transparency building measures with China

I, along with @SenJeffMerkley @RepDonBeyer & @RepGaramendi, am leading 50 colleagues to urge @POTUS to shape a #NuclearPostureReview that reduces the military role of US nuclear weapons and negotiates mutual limits that prevent the tit-for-tat arms race of the Cold War. https://t.co/UCFFTq2Mgt
Specifically, all sides should show an openness to notifications of military exercises, the non-placement of INF Treaty range missiles, and limits on all types of nuclear weapons.

Our steadfast commitment to the NATO alliance and Ukraine’s sovereignty is non-negotiable. What should be negotiable are risk reduction and arms control measures with Russia that can advance our mutual security.

I welcome the Biden administration’s efforts to seek a diplomatic resolution. There is a path forward if Putin negotiates in good faith. But we must be clear-eyed that Putin’s actions, present and past, show he’s bent on destabilizing the region.

The crisis in Ukraine is the making of Vladimir Putin. Putin has a choice: he can launch a bloody, intractable war that leads to crushing sanctions and international isolation, or he can choose the diplomatic track, which is the path the Russian and Ukrainian people desire.

Reducing emissions is our best chance to achieve a livable future. But Republicans are asking the Supreme Court to gut the Clean Air Act. I'm joining 190+ of my Democratic colleagues to defend the Clean Air Act from Republican attacks. https://t.co/wqORGndqqb

My deepest condolences go out to the Owens family, his friends, his loved ones, and all of those whose lives have forever been impacted by his pioneering presence and achievements. Bill Owens will be forever missed.

For 50 years, Bill Owens was my friend and inspiration. His presence grounded me in the realities of today’s struggles, and his spirit lifted my gaze and countless others to the opportunities and justice that remained to be created for future generations.

He worked to create the State Office of Minority Business Assistance and the Summer Youth Jobs Program and for passage of the Assault Weapons Ban. The legacy of that important work continues to this day.

I was proud to support his effort with Doris Bunte and Mel King to create the first majority Black Senate District. The first Black State Senator needed to have a loud voice, and Bill Owens’s was as resonant and powerful and lasting as history required.

Bill and I came in together as freshmen state representatives. It was a time of unprecedented historical consequence both nationally and in the Commonwealth, and no one was better positioned to lead than Bill Owens.
Bill Owens learned the lessons of our nation’s history, he rewrote them, and then taught the-powers-that-be from his own textbook on building political and economic power.

Bill Owens fought to ensure Black families and workers got the rights and representation denied to them. He fought to become the first Black State Senator just like he fought for housing justice, for reparations, for Roxbury Community College, and for equal opportunity for all. https://t.co/AIur4heIf1

Then we can tack on any other of the enormously important provisions to help working families that can reach 50 votes. This is not a climate-only package. But we can use climate as our starting point.

Democrats have broad agreement on provisions to address our climate crisis, create millions of jobs, drive down emissions, and address environmental justice in our communities. So let's start there. But we need to move quickly. We need to move from words to action. https://t.co/whoFcGv819

Abolish the filibuster. Pass voting rights legislation. https://t.co/qyzE28w6kw

Reports show at-home tests can cost as little as $2 each to manufacture but sell for $12 or more. Manufacturers and retailers must do more to ensure people see reasonable prices for these tests.

The filibuster is an anti-democratic, Jim Crow relic that is blocking progress on issues from voting rights to climate action to justice for the January 6th insurrection.

If we want to see progress on the most critical issues of our time, then we need to abolish the filibuster.

In 2021 alone, Republicans passed 34 laws in 19 states to restrict access to voting. The Senate can act now to fix this injustice. We must pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Act and the Freedom to Vote Act, and we must abolish the filibuster to do it.
SOON: I'll be on with @HallieOnMSNBC to discuss the urgent effort to pass voting rights legislation, what comes next for Build Back Better, and more. Tune in.

"Give us the ballot," Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. demanded in 1957. His words are as powerful and relevant today as ever. The United States government must finally protect Black Americans' right to vote from the right-wing, racist, and anti-democratic forces in our country. https://t.co/jBvr209bwo

Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. taught us that the dream of freedom could only be realized when every person has a fair and equal vote at the ballot box. We must pass the John Lewis Voting Rights Act and the Freedom to Vote Act now, and we must abolish the filibuster to do it. https://t.co/eKAfT2ByZi

Encouraging news that FERC is reconsidering the Weymouth compressor station. I look forward to continuing to work with the Weymouth community and the dedicated activists to ensure this dangerous project is finally shut down for good.

Our Haitian neighbors who enrich our communities deserve our protection and love. And they deserve our commitment to assisting rebuilding efforts in Haiti which continues to feel the effects of the 2010 and subsequent earthquakes as well as political and humanitarian challenges.

Massachusetts is home to 86,000 Haitians. They power our hospitals and nursing homes, own small and large businesses, and their children become civic leaders at all levels of government, with Boston electing its first Haitian-American, @ruthzee4boston, to the City Council.

Temporary Protected Status continues to protect from deportation many Haitian nationals living in the U.S. But our work must not stop there. Haitian people and other immigrants who come to our country seeking a safer and stable life deserve a pathway to citizenship.

On January 12, 2010 a devastating 7.0 magnitude earthquake shook Haiti. 250,500 Haitian people were estimated to have died and 300,000 injured. 12 years later, we honor the victims with our dedication to the survivors and continuing rebuilding efforts driven by local communities.

Throughout the pandemic, viewers across the country have relied on community media to stay safe, healthy, and informed. The Protecting Community Television Act will ensure that community TV operations continue to receive the resources they need to educate and inform viewers.

As a result, local governments have to decide between supporting PEG stations in cable franchise agreements and supporting other important services for critical community institutions like schools and libraries.

However, in August, 2019, the FCC voted to permit cable companies to assign a value to these contributions and then subtract that amount from the franchise fees the cable operator pays the local community.

Currently, local governments are permitted to require that cable companies meet demonstrated community needs by providing in-kind contributions that benefit schools, public safety buildings, and public, educational, and government (PEG) channels, known as community TV stations.

In this era of media consolidation and globalization, it is critical that we preserve community media that lifts up local voices. I'm proud to reintroduce the Protecting Community Television Act with @SenatorBaldwin, @RepAnnaEshoo, and @RepPeterDeFazio.
https://t.co/d19sjoP4PH
